updates.title: Figma acquires AI-powered media generation company Weavy, expanding its AI capabilities with plans to integrate into the Figma platform under the Weave brand.
Nvidia becomes the first public company to reach $5 trillion market cap while investing up to $1 billion in AI coding startup Poolside, reinforcing its dominance in the AI infrastructure space.
ElevenLabs CEO predicts AI audio models will become 'commoditized' over time, suggesting a shift toward application-layer differentiation in voice synthesis and audio AI tools.
Grammarly rebrands to 'Superhuman' after acquiring the email client and launches a new AI assistant, marking a significant expansion beyond grammar checking into broader productivity AI.

Character.AI ends its chatbot experience for kids following lawsuits and public outcry after teenager suicides, while Microsoft releases Windows 11's Vision Pro-like remote desktop feature for Quest 3 headsets.
